reviewText: An excellent docuentary of those interested in WW2 history.  As an old Navy Dog I enjoyed this one very much and it sits on my shelf of WW@ history DVDs
Title: N/A

reviewText: The material they went over was in depth and very interesting about the modern history of submarining, of course the submarine is a recent history mostly any way. However the over repetition of information and the same with the photography made the whole series much longer than it really needed to be. It probably could have been done with 2 DVDs instead of 4. As they say, art is the essence, meaning that if you want to define something do it in as little space as possible to crystallize the idea of what is being portrayed. It is small wonder I kept falling asleep while watching it. It kept dragging out longer and longer.
summary: Very Interesting information, but too much repetition.

reviewText: Service aboard  a U.S. Navy ballistic-missile submarine ---now that's impressive. Potential adversaries are going to thinktwice knowing we have missile launching submarines inlocations unknown to them. Where these subs go and when isshrouded in secrecy. They range across the oceans in silence, adefinite deterrent against any aggressor that might want tostart a war..
